Good Comments: Good translation with no obvious grammer errors, good video quality, somewhat slow releases for the later eps
Although slow, Genjo releases h264 versions of Blue Drop.

They did a very good job on this, both video quality wise and translation wise, and they have a organized website.  The releases could be a little faster, but its not agonizingly slow like some groups (so far they have been within a week).
well edited, no obnoxious errors or redundant notes
prime quality subs, if not too slow in releases. weeks behind other groups
Dropped it after Episode 8
dropped it >.>
Bad Comments: Decent translation and editing; lost a few points on QC from at least ep1's POV. Overall a reasonable release however.

Even though I've never heard of this group, nor have I seen any of their past releases, they did a decent job on Blue Drop. The subs were without any spelling mistakes, typesetting was fairly well done, and the ED karaoke was nice. I also liked the font.
Great subs, nearly perfect translations and editing.
Excellent quality subs!
Good quality subs but somewhat slow releases.
Nice sub but droped

Good Comments: Inaccurate translation. General point gets across, but some very simple phrases get mistranlated and I wasn't even actively listening for them.
Bad Comments: Probably the worst fansubs I've ever seen. I've never seen so much made up shit in one episode.

Good Comments: Far too slow for my liking.
Used a separate color for each of the main characters.  Good file size.  Good quality compression.
Slow on the releases, but I would rather have that than the crap the other KnJ groups are putting out. Very nice subs, slow release, desu~
GREAT

Easily the most accurate group
